column4: ok I managed to install ubuntu. but it wrote over my already existing grub that picks it's files from a separate partition...how can I get that one back to use with ubuntu?
Could you please clarify your problem?

I already had a linux installed, whit it's own grub and menu.lst. I installed ubuntu and grub reinstalled over my old one, so it gets it's files from my new ubuntu partition. if I decide to remove ubuntu I won't be able to boot again. so I want the old grub back. easy task?
Sure. As long as you haven't done anything to your old partitions, it should be easy enough to setup grub to boot into the old partitions.
